2895614a-e829-4086-8875-65b6342be4b8.content: What are the key differences between Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes?

Type 1 diabetes is an autoimmune condition where the pancreas produces little to no insulin. Type 2 diabetes involves insulin resistance or insufficient insulin production. Management differs significantly.
Hyperglycemia symptoms include increased thirst, frequent urination, blurred vision, and fatigue. These occur when blood glucose levels are too high.
